snippet: With the economy coming up short by millions of jobs since the start of the Great Recession, aid to state and local governments would have a powerful effect on hiring.
abstract: Editorial, citing analysis by the Economic Policy Institute, contends that Republicans cost the economy 2.3 million jobs when they blocked Pres Obama's $350 billion jobs bill in late 2011; argues that the best way to reverse job losses would be for Congress to provide fiscal aid to states, solution resisted by Republicans in order to keep their hopes alive to win the White House.
lead_paragraph: With the economy coming up short by millions of jobs since the start of the Great Recession, aid to state and local governments would have a powerful effect on hiring.
